body:
### Problem

When doing an edit in a buffer that modifies the last line, but not its trailing newline character, the changes sent to a Language Server are wrong, corrupting the internal representation of the LS of the buffer.

I first thought that this was an issue with https://github.com/ribru17/ts_query_ls , but it seems like it's an issue with Neovim core instead. My original issue is https://github.com/ribru17/ts_query_ls/issues/247 and it includes a minimal repro for the issue. I'm gonna copy-paste it below for convenience.

It's also important to note that if `3`  is replaced by an equivalent operation that does include the trailing newline in the last line of the buffer (so, `ggVGy` and then `ggVGp`), the error does not happen.

### Steps to reproduce

1. `nvim --clean -u minimal_init.lua lua.scm '+set ft=query'` with the following `minimal_init.lua`

```lua
vim.env.LAZY_STDPATH = ".repro"
load(vim.fn.system "curl -s https://raw.githubusercontent.com/folke/lazy.nvim/main/bootstrap.lua")()

require("lazy.minit").repro {
  spec = {
    { "neovim/nvim-lspconfig" },
    {
      "mason-org/mason.nvim",
      build = ":MasonUpdate",
      config = function()
        require("mason").setup {}
        local mr = require "mason-registry"
        mr.refresh(function()
          local p = mr.get_package "ts_query_ls"
          if not p:is_installed() then p:install() end
        end)
      end,
    },
  },
}

vim.o.number = true

vim.lsp.enable "ts_query_ls"

vim.keymap.set("x", "ag", function()
  vim.cmd.normal { vim.keycode [[<c-\><c-n>]], bang = true }
  local key = vim.fn.visualmode()

  vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, { 1, 0 })
  vim.cmd.normal { key, bang = true }

  local end_row = vim.fn.line "$"
  local end_col = #vim.api.nvim_buf_get_lines(0, end_row - 1, end_row, true)[1] - 1
  vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, { end_row, end_col })
end)

vim.keymap.set("n", "<F4>", function()
  vim.lsp.buf.format()
end)
```

2. Paste the following into the file (the error does not happen if there is only one query, there must be at least two of them)

```query
(foo) @foo

(bar) @bar
```

3. `vagy` (using the `ag` keymap provided in the minimal repro) `vagP`
4. `<F4>` (using the keymap to format the buffer provided in the minimal repro). A new empty line is added at the end of the buffer
5. `<F4>`. The empty line added in `4` is removed.

Notes:

- You can keep repeating `4` and `5` and `ts_query_ls` will keep adding/removing that last empty line.
- If `3` is skipped, `ts_query_ls` never adds an empty line at the end of the file on format.
- If you `:e|set ft=query` (to, AFAIK, reset the internal representation of `ts_query_ls` of the buffer), `ts_query_ls` stops adding an empty line at the end of the file on format (the `set ft=query` is necessary because the file won't trigger the Neovim `query` filetype detection on its own depending on its location).

### Expected behavior

The behavior should be the same weather or not the last newline character of the last line in a buf is selected or not. i.e. the LS should still have a correct representation of the buffer.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.5 Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.1763318511

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

archlinux latest

### Terminal name/version

wezterm 20240203-110809-5046fc22

### $TERM environment variable

wezterm

### Installation

pacman
title: LSP: incorrect changes sent to LS on edits of last line that do not include its trailing newline character
